channel.title: Comments on: Real Doesn’t Have to Be Toxic
channel.description: BDSM, books and missing links by Xiao Yingtai

item.title: By: Kink’s transgressions: breaking the rules | Valery North - Writer
item.dc:creator: Kink’s transgressions: breaking the rules | Valery North - Writer
item.description: […] last night, I wrote about why my kink is not about transgression, taking Yingtai’s side rather than Remittance Girl’s “it’s all to do with transgression, or pretending […]
item.content:encoded: […] last night, I wrote about why my kink is not about transgression, taking Yingtai’s side rather than Remittance Girl’s “it’s all to do with transgression, or pretending […]

item.title: By: Neither bad nor pretending to be: kinky ≠ perverted | Valery North - Writer
item.dc:creator: Neither bad nor pretending to be: kinky ≠ perverted | Valery North - Writer
item.description: […] Yingtai responds to Remittance Girl’s assertion that, “Real perverts believe with deep sincerity in the rules they break. They have faith that what they are doing is wrong.” with the answer that, “Real Doesn’t Have to Be Toxic“. […]
item.content:encoded: […] Yingtai responds to Remittance Girl’s assertion that, “Real perverts believe with deep sincerity in the rules they break. They have faith that what they are doing is wrong.” with the answer that, “Real Doesn’t Have to Be Toxic“. […]

item.title: By: Xiao Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Xiao Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/real-doesnt-have-to-be-toxic/#comment-175">JT</a>.
It is very strange to me too. But she says she is at peace with it. I'm starting to think the less I say the better.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to JT.

It is very strange to me too. But she says she is at peace with it. I’m starting to think the less I say the better.

item.title: By: JT
item.dc:creator: JT
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/real-doesnt-have-to-be-toxic/#comment-173">Xiao Yingtai</a>.
Yes, it does seem heartrending, doesn't it? I can't imagine being unable to be at peace with my ability to experience pleasure, or always believing that there is a core of evil in my own happiness. Unless I am totally misunderstanding what Remittance Girl is saying?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Xiao Yingtai.

Yes, it does seem heartrending, doesn’t it? I can’t imagine being unable to be at peace with my ability to experience pleasure, or always believing that there is a core of evil in my own happiness. Unless I am totally misunderstanding what Remittance Girl is saying?

item.title: By: Xiao Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Xiao Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/real-doesnt-have-to-be-toxic/#comment-171">JT</a>.
Thank you so much, JT. You put it much more concisely and clearly than I could. And I really need a friendly voice right now so it's very welcome. I wouldn't say Remittance Girl's point of view is myopic, but it is heartrending if that's what she really believes. And after our Twitter conversation I am pretty convinced.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to JT.

Thank you so much, JT. You put it much more concisely and clearly than I could. And I really need a friendly voice right now so it’s very welcome. I wouldn’t say Remittance Girl’s point of view is myopic, but it is heartrending if that’s what she really believes. And after our Twitter conversation I am pretty convinced.

item.title: By: JT
item.dc:creator: JT
item.description: Very well said, Yingtai. If someone's "kink" is to feel that they are behaving unethically when engaging in consensual BDSM then I hope that their feelings of transgression bring them pleasure, but it certainly doesn't mean that the rest of us aren't "real" just because we don't share that kink. Remittance Girl's point of view on this seems very myopic, reminiscent of people who insist that "gay sex isn't really sex".
item.content:encoded: Very well said, Yingtai. If someone’s “kink” is to feel that they are behaving unethically when engaging in consensual BDSM then I hope that their feelings of transgression bring them pleasure, but it certainly doesn’t mean that the rest of us aren’t “real” just because we don’t share that kink. Remittance Girl’s point of view on this seems very myopic, reminiscent of people who insist that “gay sex isn’t really sex”.
